fields.name: characterData
fields.description: Obtain the character data object that allows the retrieval of individual characters or filtered collections of characters.

fields.name: gameData
fields.description: Obtain the game data object that holds collections of static data such as abilities, achievements, classes, items, NPCs, etc..

fields.name: guildData
fields.description: Obtain the guild data object that allows the retrieval of individual guilds or filtered collections of guilds.

fields.name: progressRaceData
fields.description: Obtain information about an ongoing world first or realm first race. Inactive when no race is occurring. This data only updates once every 30 seconds, so you do not need to fetch this information more often than that.

fields.name: rateLimitData
fields.description: Obtain the rate limit data object to see how many points have been spent by this key.

fields.name: reportData
fields.description: Obtain the report data object that allows the retrieval of individual reports or filtered collections of reports by guild or by user.

fields.name: userData
fields.description: Obtain the user object that allows the retrieval of the authorized user's id and username.

fields.name: worldData
fields.description: Obtain the world data object that holds collections of data such as all expansions, regions, subregions, servers, dungeon/raid zones, and encounters.

types.name: CharacterData
types.description: The CharacterData object enables the retrieval of single characters or filtered collections of characters.

fields.name: character
fields.description: Obtain a specific character either by id or by name/server_slug/server_region.

fields.name: characters
fields.description: A collection of characters for a specific guild.

types.name: Int
types.description:
The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric
values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

types.name: String
types.description:
The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8
character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to
represent free-form human-readable text.

types.name: Character
types.description: A player character. Characters can earn individual rankings and appear in reports.

fields.name: canonicalID
fields.description: The canonical ID of the character. If a character renames or transfers, then the canonical id can be used to identify the most recent version of the character.

fields.name: claimed
fields.description: Whether this character is claimed by the current user. Only accessible if accessed via the user API with the "view-user-profile" scope.

fields.name: classID
fields.description: The class id of the character.

fields.name: encounterRankings
fields.description: Encounter rankings information for a character, filterable to specific zones, bosses, metrics, etc. This data is not considered frozen, and it can change without notice. Use at your own risk.

fields.name: faction
fields.description: The faction of the character.

fields.name: gameData
fields.description: Cached game data such as gear for the character. This data was fetched from the appropriate source (Blizzard APIs for WoW, Lodestone for FF). This call will only return a cached copy of the data if it exists already. It will not go out to Blizzard or Lodestone to fetch a new copy.

fields.name: guildRank
fields.description: The guild rank of the character in their primary guild. This is not the user rank on the site, but the rank according to the game data, e.g., a Warcraft guild rank or an FFXIV Free Company rank.

fields.name: guilds
fields.description: All guilds that the character belongs to.

fields.name: hidden
fields.description: Whether or not the character has all its rankings hidden.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The ID of the character.

fields.name: level
fields.description: The level of the character.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the character.

fields.name: recentReports
fields.description: Recent reports for the character.

fields.name: server
fields.description: The server that the character belongs to.

fields.name: zoneRankings
fields.description: Rankings information for a character, filterable to specific zones, bosses, metrics, etc. This data is not considered frozen, and it can change without notice. Use at your own risk.

types.name: Boolean
types.description: The `Boolean` scalar type represents `true` or `false`.

types.name: RankingCompareType
types.description: Whether or not rankings are compared against best scores for the entire tier or against all parses in a two week window.

types.name: CharacterRankingMetricType
types.description: All the possible metrics.

types.name: RoleType
types.description: Used to specify a tank, healer or DPS role.

types.name: RankingTimeframeType
types.description: Whether or not rankings are today or historical.

types.name: GameFaction
types.description: A faction that a player or guild can belong to. Factions have an integer id used to identify them throughout the API and a localized name describing the faction.

fields.name: id
fields.description: An integer representing the faction id.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The localized name of the faction.

types.name: Guild
types.description: A single guild. Guilds earn their own rankings and contain characters. They may correspond to a guild in-game or be a custom guild created just to hold reports and rankings.

fields.name: competitionMode
fields.description: Whether or not the guild has competition mode enabled.

fields.name: description
fields.description: The description for the guild that is displayed with the guild name on the site.

fields.name: faction
fields.description: The faction of the guild.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The ID of the guild.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the guild.

fields.name: server
fields.description: The server that the guild belongs to.

fields.name: stealthMode
fields.description: Whether or not the guild has stealth mode enabled.

fields.name: tags
fields.description: The tags used to label reports. In the site UI, these are called raid teams.

fields.name: members
fields.description: The member roster for a specific guild. The result of this query is a paginated list of characters. This query only works for games where the guild roster is verifiable, e.g., it does not work for Classic Warcraft.

fields.name: currentUserRank
fields.description: The current user's rank within the guild. Only accessible via user authentication with the "view-user-profile" scope.

fields.name: zoneRanking
fields.description: The guild's ranking for a zone. If `zoneId` is unset or null, uses the latest zone.

fields.name: data
fields.description: List of items on the current page

fields.name: total
fields.description: Number of total items selected by the query

fields.name: per_page
fields.description: Number of items returned per page

fields.name: current_page
fields.description: Current page of the cursor

fields.name: from
fields.description: Number of the first item returned

fields.name: to
fields.description: Number of the last item returned

fields.name: last_page
fields.description: The last page (number of pages)

fields.name: has_more_pages
fields.description: Determines if cursor has more pages after the current page

types.name: GuildAttendance
types.description: Attendance for a specific report within a guild.

fields.name: code
fields.description: The code of the report for the raid night.

fields.name: players
fields.description: The players that attended that raid night.

fields.name: startTime
fields.description: The start time of the raid night.

fields.name: zone
fields.description: The principal zone of the raid night.

types.name: PlayerAttendance
types.description: Attendance for a specific player on a specific raid night.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the player.

fields.name: type
fields.description: The class of the player.

fields.name: presence
fields.description: Presence info for the player. A value of 1 means the player was present. A value of 2 indicates present but on the bench.

types.name: Float
types.description:
The `Float` scalar type represents signed double-precision fractional
values as specified by
[IEEE 754](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_floating_point).

types.name: Zone
types.description: A single zone from an expansion that represents a raid, dungeon, arena, etc.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The ID of the zone.

fields.name: brackets
fields.description: The bracket information for this zone. This field will be null if the zone does not support brackets.

fields.name: difficulties
fields.description: A list of all the difficulties supported for this zone.

fields.name: encounters
fields.description: The encounters found within this zone.

fields.name: expansion
fields.description: The expansion that this zone belongs to.

fields.name: frozen
fields.description: Whether or not the entire zone (including all its partitions) is permanently frozen. When a zone is frozen, data involving that zone will never change and can be cached forever.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the zone.

fields.name: partitions
fields.description: A list of all the partitions supported for this zone.

types.name: Bracket
types.description: A bracket description for a given raid zone. Brackets have a minimum value, maximum value, and a bucket that can be used to establish all of the possible brackets. The type field indicates what the brackets represent, e.g., item levels or game patches, etc.

fields.name: min
fields.description: An integer representing the minimum value used by bracket number 1, etc.

fields.name: max
fields.description: An integer representing the value used by bracket N when there are a total of N brackets, etc.

fields.name: bucket
fields.description: A float representing the value to increment when moving from bracket 1 to bracket N, etc.

fields.name: type
fields.description: The localized name of the bracket type.

types.name: Difficulty
types.description: A single difficulty for a given raid zone. Difficulties have an integer value representing the actual difficulty, a localized name that describes the difficulty level, and a list of valid sizes for the difficulty level.

fields.name: id
fields.description: An integer representing a specific difficulty level within a zone. For example, in World of Warcraft, this could be Mythic. In FF, it could be Savage, etc.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The localized name for the difficulty level.

fields.name: sizes
fields.description: A list of supported sizes for the difficulty level. An empty result means that the difficulty level has a flexible raid size.

types.name: Encounter
types.description: A single encounter for the game.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The ID of the encounter.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The localized name of the encounter.

fields.name: characterRankings
fields.description: Player rankings information for a zone. This data is not considered frozen, and it can change without notice. Use at your own risk.

fields.name: fightRankings
fields.description: Fight rankings information for a zone. This data is not considered frozen, and it can change without notice. Use at your own risk.

fields.name: zone
fields.description: The zone that this encounter is found in.

fields.name: journalID
fields.description: The Blizzard journal ID, used as the identifier in the encounter journal and various Blizzard APIs like progression.

types.name: LeaderboardRank
types.description: Source of the rank. Most ranks only support log ranks, but some games (ESO) and content types (Retail WoW M+) support leaderboard ranks with no backing log.

types.name: HardModeLevelRankFilter
types.description: Hard mode level filter. Used for WoW Classic Hard Modes. For ESO hard modes, use `difficulty`. Hard mode levels range from 0-4, with 0 being normal mode and 4 being the highest hard mode.

types.name: ExternalBuffRankFilter
types.description: Whether to include ranks with major external buffs. Not all metrics, zones and games support this. It will be ignored if unsupported.

types.name: FightRankingMetricType
types.description: All the possible metrics.

types.name: Expansion
types.description: A single expansion for the game.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The ID of the expansion.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The localized name of the expansion.

fields.name: zones
fields.description: The zones (e.g., raids and dungeons) supported for this expansion.

types.name: Partition
types.description: A single partition for a given raid zone. Partitions have an integer value representing the actual partition and a localized name that describes what the partition represents. Partitions contain their own rankings, statistics and all stars.

fields.name: id
fields.description: An integer representing a specific partition within a zone.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The localized name for partition.

fields.name: compactName
fields.description: The compact localized name for the partition. Typically an abbreviation to conserve space.

fields.name: default
fields.description: Whether or not the partition is the current default when viewing rankings or statistics for the zone.

types.name: Server
types.description: A single server. Servers correspond to actual game servers that characters and guilds reside on.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The ID of the server.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the server in the locale of the subregion that the server belongs to.

fields.name: normalizedName
fields.description: The normalized name is a transformation of the name, dropping spaces. It is how the server appears in a World of Warcraft log file.

fields.name: slug
fields.description: The server slug, also a transformation of the name following Blizzard rules. For retail World of Warcraft realms, this slug will be in English. For all other games, the slug is just a transformation of the name field.

fields.name: region
fields.description: The region that this server belongs to.

fields.name: subregion
fields.description: The subregion that this server belongs to.

fields.name: guilds
fields.description: The guilds found on this server (and any servers connected to this one.

fields.name: characters
fields.description: The characters found on this server (and any servers connected to this one.

types.name: Region
types.description: A single region for the game.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The ID of the region.

fields.name: compactName
fields.description: The localized compact name of the region, e.g., US for United States.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The localized name of the region.

fields.name: slug
fields.description: The slug for the region, usable when looking up characters and guilds by server.

fields.name: subregions
fields.description: The subregions found within this region.

fields.name: servers
fields.description: The servers found within this region.

types.name: Subregion
types.description: A single subregion. Subregions are used to divide a region into sub-categories, such as French or German subregions of a Europe region.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The ID of the subregion.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The localized name of the subregion.

fields.name: region
fields.description: The region that this subregion is found in.

fields.name: servers
fields.description: The servers found within this region.

fields.name: data
fields.description: List of items on the current page

fields.name: total
fields.description: Number of total items selected by the query

fields.name: per_page
fields.description: Number of items returned per page

fields.name: current_page
fields.description: Current page of the cursor

fields.name: from
fields.description: Number of the first item returned

fields.name: to
fields.description: Number of the last item returned

fields.name: last_page
fields.description: The last page (number of pages)

fields.name: has_more_pages
fields.description: Determines if cursor has more pages after the current page

fields.name: data
fields.description: List of items on the current page

fields.name: total
fields.description: Number of total items selected by the query

fields.name: per_page
fields.description: Number of items returned per page

fields.name: current_page
fields.description: Current page of the cursor

fields.name: from
fields.description: Number of the first item returned

fields.name: to
fields.description: Number of the last item returned

fields.name: last_page
fields.description: The last page (number of pages)

fields.name: has_more_pages
fields.description: Determines if cursor has more pages after the current page

fields.name: data
fields.description: List of items on the current page

fields.name: total
fields.description: Number of total items selected by the query

fields.name: per_page
fields.description: Number of items returned per page

fields.name: current_page
fields.description: Current page of the cursor

fields.name: from
fields.description: Number of the first item returned

fields.name: to
fields.description: Number of the last item returned

fields.name: last_page
fields.description: The last page (number of pages)

fields.name: has_more_pages
fields.description: Determines if cursor has more pages after the current page

types.name: GuildTag
types.description: The tag for a specific guild. Tags can be used to categorize reports within a guild. In the site UI, they are referred to as report tags.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The ID of the tag.

fields.name: guild
fields.description: The guild that the tag belongs to.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the tag.

types.name: GuildRank
types.description: Rank within a guild or team on the website. This is separate from in-game ranks and does NOT correspond to the rank of the user or character in-game.

types.name: GuildZoneRankings
types.description: A guild's rankings within a zone.

fields.name: progress
fields.description: The progress ranks for the guild. Always uses the highest difficulty.

fields.name: speed
fields.description: The all-star based speed rank for the guild.

fields.name: completeRaidSpeed
fields.description: The complete raid speed ranks for the guild. Most non-Classic WoW zones do not support complete raid ranks.

types.name: WorldRegionServerRankPositions
types.description: A collection containing some combination of world, region, and server ranks.

fields.name: number
fields.description: The ordinal rank (usually written "Rank N"). Rank 1 = highest.

fields.name: percentile
fields.description: The percentile of the rank as an integer in [0, 100]. Always null for guild ranks.

fields.name: color
fields.description: The color class used by the site for this rank.

fields.name: data
fields.description: List of items on the current page

fields.name: total
fields.description: Number of total items selected by the query

fields.name: per_page
fields.description: Number of items returned per page

fields.name: current_page
fields.description: Current page of the cursor

fields.name: from
fields.description: Number of the first item returned

fields.name: to
fields.description: Number of the last item returned

fields.name: last_page
fields.description: The last page (number of pages)

fields.name: has_more_pages
fields.description: Determines if cursor has more pages after the current page

types.name: Report
types.description: A single report uploaded by a player to a guild or personal logs.

fields.name: code
fields.description: The report code, a unique value used to identify the report.

fields.name: endTime
fields.description: The end time of the report. This is a UNIX timestamp representing the timestamp of the last event contained in the report.

fields.name: events
fields.description: A set of paginated report events, filterable via arguments like type, source, target, ability, etc. This data is not considered frozen, and it can change without notice. Use at your own risk.

fields.name: exportedSegments
fields.description: The number of exported segments in the report. This is how many segments have been processed for rankings.

fields.name: fights
fields.description: A set of fights with details about participating players.

fields.name: graph
fields.description: A graph of information for a report, filterable via arguments like type, source, target, ability, etc. This data is not considered frozen, and it can change without notice. Use at your own risk.

fields.name: guild
fields.description: The guild that the report belongs to. If this is null, then the report was uploaded to the user's personal logs.

fields.name: guildTag
fields.description: The guild tag that the report belongs to. If this is null, then the report was not tagged.

fields.name: owner
fields.description: The user that uploaded the report.

fields.name: masterData
fields.description: Data from the report's master file. This includes version info, all of the players, NPCs and pets that occur in the report, and all the game abilities used in the report.

fields.name: playerDetails
fields.description: A table of information for the players of a report, including their specs, talents, gear, etc. This data is not considered frozen, and it can change without notice. Use at your own risk.

fields.name: rankedCharacters
fields.description: A list of all characters that ranked on kills in the report.

fields.name: rankings
fields.description: Rankings information for a report, filterable to specific fights, bosses, metrics, etc. This data is not considered frozen, and it can change without notice. Use at your own risk.

fields.name: region
fields.description: The region of the report.

fields.name: revision
fields.description: The revision of the report. This number is increased when reports get re-exported.

fields.name: segments
fields.description: The number of uploaded segments in the report.

fields.name: startTime
fields.description: The start time of the report. This is a UNIX timestamp representing the timestamp of the first event contained in the report.

fields.name: table
fields.description: A table of information for a report, filterable via arguments like type, source, target, ability, etc. This data is not considered frozen, and it can change without notice. Use at your own risk.

fields.name: title
fields.description: A title for the report.

fields.name: visibility
fields.description: The visibility level of the report. The possible values are 'public', 'private', and 'unlisted'.

fields.name: zone
fields.description: The principal zone that the report contains fights for. Null if no supported zone exists.

fields.name: archiveStatus
fields.description: Whether this report has been archived. Events, tables, and graphs for archived reports are inaccessible unless the retrieving user has a subscription including archive access.

fields.name: phases
fields.description: Phase information for all boss encounters observed in this report. This requires loading fight data, but does not double-charge API points if you load fights and phases.

types.name: EventDataType
types.description: The type of events or tables to examine.

types.name: HostilityType
types.description: Whether or not to fetch information for friendlies or enemies.

types.name: KillType
types.description: A filter for kills vs wipes and encounters vs trash.

types.name: ReportEventPaginator
types.description: The ReportEventPaginator represents a paginated list of report events.

fields.name: data
fields.description: The list of events obtained.

fields.name: nextPageTimestamp
fields.description: A timestamp to pass in as the start time when fetching the next page of data.

types.name: ReportFight
types.description: The ReportFight represents a single fight that occurs in the report.

fields.name: averageItemLevel
fields.description: The average item level of the players in the fight.

fields.name: bossPercentage
fields.description: The percentage health of the active boss or bosses at the end of a fight.

fields.name: boundingBox
fields.description: The bounding box that encloses the positions of all players/enemies in the fight.

fields.name: classicSeasonID
fields.description: The season ID of a Classic fight. Will only be nonzero for Season of Mastery in Vanilla for now.

fields.name: completeRaid
fields.description: Whether or not a fight represents an entire raid from start to finish, e.g., in Classic WoW a complete run of Blackwing Lair.

fields.name: difficulty
fields.description: The difficulty setting for the raid, dungeon, or arena. Null for trash.

fields.name: dungeonPulls
fields.description: For a dungeon, a list of pulls that occurred in the dungeon. Pulls have details such as the enemies involved in the pull and map info showing where the pull took place.

fields.name: encounterID
fields.description: The encounter ID of the fight. If the ID is 0, the fight is considered a trash fight.

fields.name: endTime
fields.description: The end time of the fight. This is a timestamp with millisecond precision that is relative to the start of the report, i.e., the start of the report is considered time 0.

fields.name: enemyNPCs
fields.description: Information about enemy NPCs involved in the fight. Includes report IDs, instance counts, and instance group counts for each NPC.

fields.name: enemyPets
fields.description: Information about enemy pets involved in the fight. Includes report IDs, instance counts, and instance group counts for each pet.

fields.name: enemyPlayers
fields.description: The IDs of all players involved in a fight. These players can be referenced in the master data actors table to get detailed information about each participant.

fields.name: fightPercentage
fields.description: The actual completion percentage of the fight. This is the field used to indicate how far into a fight a wipe was, since fights can be complicated and have multiple bosses, no bosses, bosses that heal, etc.

fields.name: friendlyNPCs
fields.description: Information about friendly NPCs involved in the fight. Includes report IDs, instance counts, and instance group counts for each NPC.

fields.name: friendlyPets
fields.description: Information about friendly pets involved in the fight. Includes report IDs, instance counts, and instance group counts for each pet.

fields.name: friendlyPlayers
fields.description: The IDs of all players involved in a fight. These players can be referenced in the master data actors table to get detailed information about each participant.

fields.name: gameZone
fields.description: The game zone the fight takes place in. This should not be confused with the zones used by the sites for rankings. This is the actual in-game zone info.

fields.name: hardModeLevel
fields.description: The hard mode level of the fight. Most fights don't support optional hard modes. This only applies to bosses like Sartharion.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The report ID of the fight. This ID can be used to fetch only events, tables or graphs for this fight.

fields.name: inProgress
fields.description: Whether or not the fight is still in progress. If this field is false, it means the entire fight has been uploaded.

fields.name: keystoneAffixes
fields.description: The affixes for a Mythic+ dungeon.

fields.name: keystoneBonus
fields.description: The bonus field represents Bronze, Silver or Gold in Challenge Modes, or +1-+3 pushing of Mythic+ keys. It has the values 1, 2, and 3.

fields.name: keystoneLevel
fields.description: The keystone level for a Mythic+ dungeon.

fields.name: keystoneTime
fields.description: The completion time for a Challenge Mode or Mythic+ Dungeon. This is the official time used on Blizzard leaderboards.

fields.name: kill
fields.description: Whether or not the fight was a boss kill, i.e., successful. If this field is false, it means the fight was a wipe or a failed run, etc..

fields.name: lastPhase
fields.description: The phase that the encounter was in when the fight ended. Counts up from 1 based off the phase type (i.e., normal phase vs intermission).

fields.name: lastPhaseAsAbsoluteIndex
fields.description: The phase that the encounter was in when the fight ended. Always increases from 0, so a fight with three real phases and two intermissions would count up from 0 to 4.

fields.name: lastPhaseIsIntermission
fields.description: Whether or not the phase that the encounter was in when the fight ended was an intermission or not.

fields.name: layer
fields.description: The layer of a Torghast run.

fields.name: maps
fields.description: All the maps that were involved in a fight. For single bosses this will usually be a single map, but for dungeons it will typically be multiple maps.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the fight.

fields.name: originalEncounterID
fields.description: Some boss fights may be converted to trash fights (encounterID = 0). When this occurs, `originalEncounterID` contains the original ID of the encounter.

fields.name: phaseTransitions
fields.description: List of observed phase transitions during the fight.

fields.name: rating
fields.description: The official Blizzard rating for a completed Mythic+ dungeon or Torghast run.

fields.name: size
fields.description: The group size for the raid, dungeon, or arena. Null for trash.

fields.name: startTime
fields.description: The start time of the fight. This is a timestamp with millisecond precision that is relative to the start of the report, i.e., the start of the report is considered time 0.

fields.name: talentImportCode
fields.description: The import/export code for a Retail Dragonflight talent build. Will be null for a classic or pre-Dragonflight fight.

fields.name: wipeCalledTime
fields.description: If a wipe was explicitly called using the Companion app, then this field will contain the time. This is a timestamp with millisecond precision that is relative to the start of the report, i.e., the start of the report is considered time 0.

types.name: ReportMapBoundingBox
types.description: The ReportMapBoundingBox is a box that encloses the positions of all players and enemies in a fight or dungeon pull.

fields.name: minX
fields.description: The smallest X position.

fields.name: maxX
fields.description: The largest X position.

fields.name: minY
fields.description: The smallest Y position.

fields.name: maxY
fields.description: The largest Y position.

types.name: ReportDungeonPull
types.description: The ReportDungeonPull represents a single pull that occurs in a containing dungeon.

fields.name: boundingBox
fields.description: The bounding box that encloses the positions of all players/enemies in the fight.

fields.name: encounterID
fields.description: The encounter ID of the fight. If the ID is 0, the fight is considered a trash fight.

fields.name: endTime
fields.description: The end time of the fight. This is a timestamp with millisecond precision that is relative to the start of the report, i.e., the start of the report is considered time 0.

fields.name: enemyNPCs
fields.description: Information about enemies involved in the fight. Includes report IDs, instance counts, and instance group counts for each NPC.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The report ID of the fight. This ID can be used to fetch only events, tables or graphs for this fight.

fields.name: kill
fields.description: Whether or not the fight was a boss kill, i.e., successful. If this field is false, it means the fight was an incomplete run, etc..

fields.name: maps
fields.description: All the maps that were involved in a pull.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the fight.

fields.name: startTime
fields.description: The start time of the fight. This is a timestamp with millisecond precision that is relative to the start of the report, i.e., the start of the report is considered time 0.

fields.name: x
fields.description: The x position of the first mob damaged in the pull at the time this damage happens. Used to establish a marker position to represent where the pull took place.

fields.name: y
fields.description: The y position of the first mob damaged in the pull at the time this damage happens. Used to establish a marker position to represent where the pull took place.

types.name: ReportDungeonPullNPC
types.description: The ReportDungeonPullNPC represents participation info within a single dungeon pull for an NPC.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The report ID of the actor. This ID is used in events to identify sources and targets.

fields.name: gameID
fields.description: The game ID of the actor, e.g., so it can be looked up on external Web sites.

fields.name: minimumInstanceID
fields.description: The lowest instance ID seen during the pull.

fields.name: maximumInstanceID
fields.description: The highest instance ID seen during the pull.

fields.name: minimumInstanceGroupID
fields.description: The lowest instance group ID seen during the pull.

fields.name: maximumInstanceGroupID
fields.description: The highest instance group ID seen during the pull.

types.name: ReportMap
types.description: The ReportMap represents a single map that a fight can occur on.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The map's game ID.

types.name: ReportFightNPC
types.description: The ReportFightNPC represents participation info within a single fight for an NPC.

fields.name: gameID
fields.description: The game ID of the actor. This ID is used in events to identify sources and targets.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The report ID of the actor. This ID is used in events to identify sources and targets.

fields.name: instanceCount
fields.description: How many instances of the NPC were seen during the fight.

fields.name: groupCount
fields.description: How many packs of the NPC were seen during the fight.

fields.name: petOwner
fields.description: The report ID of the actor that owns this NPC (if it is a pet). This ID is used in events to identify sources and targets.

types.name: GameZone
types.description: A single zone for the game.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The ID of the zone.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The localized name of the zone. Will be null if no localization information exists for the zone.

types.name: PhaseTransition
types.description: A spartan representation of phase transitions during a fight.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The 1-indexed id of the phase. Phase IDs are absolute within a fight: phases with the same ID correspond to the same semantic phase.

fields.name: startTime
fields.description: The report-relative timestamp of the transition into the phase. The phase ends at the beginning of the next phase, or at the end of the fight.

types.name: GraphDataType
types.description: The type of graph to examine.

types.name: ViewType
types.description: Whether the view is by source, target, or ability.

types.name: User
types.description: A single user of the site. Most fields can only be accessed when authenticated as that user with the "view-user-profile" scope.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The ID of the user.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the user.

fields.name: guilds
fields.description: The list of guilds to which the user belongs. Only accessible via user authentication when you have the "view-user-profile" scope.

fields.name: characters
fields.description: The characters claimed by this user. Only accessible via user authentication when you have the "view-user-profile" scope.

fields.name: battleTag
fields.description: The battle tag of the user if they have linked it.

types.name: ReportMasterData
types.description: The ReporMastertData object contains information about the log version of a report, as well as the actors and abilities used in the report.

fields.name: logVersion
fields.description: The version of the client parser that was used to parse and upload this log file.

fields.name: gameVersion
fields.description: The version of the game that generated the log file. Used to distinguish Classic and Retail Warcraft primarily.

fields.name: lang
fields.description: The auto-detected locale of the report. This is the source language of the original log file.

fields.name: abilities
fields.description: A list of every ability that occurs in the report.

fields.name: actors
fields.description: A list of every actor (player, NPC, pet) that occurs in the report.

types.name: ReportAbility
types.description: The ReportAbility represents a single ability that occurs in the report.

fields.name: gameID
fields.description: The game ID of the ability.

fields.name: icon
fields.description: An icon to use for the ability.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the actor.

fields.name: type
fields.description: The type of the ability. This represents the type of damage (e.g., the spell school in WoW).

types.name: ReportActor
types.description: The ReportActor represents a single player, pet or NPC that occurs in the report.

fields.name: gameID
fields.description: The game ID of the actor.

fields.name: icon
fields.description: An icon to use for the actor. For pets and NPCs, this will be the icon the site chose to represent that actor.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The report ID of the actor. This ID is used in events to identify sources and targets.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the actor.

fields.name: petOwner
fields.description: The report ID of the actor's owner if the actor is a pet.

fields.name: server
fields.description: The normalized server name of the actor.

fields.name: subType
fields.description: The sub-type of the actor, for players it's their class, and for NPCs, they are further subdivided into normal NPCs and bosses.

fields.name: type
fields.description: The type of the actor, i.e., if it is a player, pet or NPC.

types.name: ReportRankingMetricType
types.description: All the possible metrics.

types.name: TableDataType
types.description: The type of table to examine.

types.name: ReportArchiveStatus
types.description: The archival status of a report.

fields.name: isArchived
fields.description: Whether the report has been archived.

fields.name: isAccessible
fields.description: Whether the current user can access the report. Always true if the report is not archived, and always false if not using user authentication.

fields.name: archiveDate
fields.description: The date on which the report was archived (if it has been archived).

fields.name: separatesWipes
fields.description: Whether the phases can be used to separate wipes in the report UI.

fields.name: phases
fields.description: Phase metadata for all phases in this encounter.

types.name: PhaseMetadata
types.description: Information about a phase from a boss encounter.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Phase ID. 1-indexed

fields.name: isIntermission
fields.description: Whether this phase represents an intermission.

types.name: GameData
types.description: The game object contains collections of data such as NPCs, classes, abilities, items, maps, etc. Game data only changes when major game patches are released, so you should cache results for as long as possible and only update when new content is released for the game.

fields.name: abilities
fields.description: The player and enemy abilities for the game.

fields.name: ability
fields.description: Obtain a single ability for the game.

fields.name: achievement
fields.description: Obtain a single achievement for the game.

fields.name: achievements
fields.description: Achievements for the game.

fields.name: affix
fields.description: Obtain a single affix for the game.

fields.name: affixes
fields.description: The affixes for the game.

fields.name: class
fields.description: Obtain a single class for the game.

fields.name: classes
fields.description: Obtain the supported classes for the game.

fields.name: enchant
fields.description: Obtain a single enchant for the game.

fields.name: enchants
fields.description: Enchants for the game.

fields.name: factions
fields.description: Obtain all the factions that guilds and players can belong to.

fields.name: item
fields.description: Obtain a single item for the game.

fields.name: item_set
fields.description: Obtain a single item set for the game.

fields.name: item_sets
fields.description: Item sets for the game.

fields.name: items
fields.description: Items for the game.

fields.name: map
fields.description: Obtain a single map for the game.

fields.name: maps
fields.description: Maps for the game.

fields.name: npc
fields.description: Obtain a single NPC for the game.

fields.name: npcs
fields.description: NPCs for the game.

fields.name: zone
fields.description: Obtain a single zone for the game, not to be confused with the worldData zones for ranking bosses and dungeons.

fields.name: zones
fields.description: Zones for the game.

fields.name: data
fields.description: List of items on the current page

fields.name: total
fields.description: Number of total items selected by the query

fields.name: per_page
fields.description: Number of items returned per page

fields.name: current_page
fields.description: Current page of the cursor

fields.name: from
fields.description: Number of the first item returned

fields.name: to
fields.description: Number of the last item returned

fields.name: last_page
fields.description: The last page (number of pages)

fields.name: has_more_pages
fields.description: Determines if cursor has more pages after the current page

fields.name: icon
fields.description: The icon for the ability.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The localized name of the ability. Will be null if no localization information exists for the ability.

types.name: GuildData
types.description: The GuildData object enables the retrieval of single guilds or filtered collections of guilds.

fields.name: guild
fields.description: Obtain a specific guild either by id or by name/serverSlug/serverRegion.

fields.name: guilds
fields.description: The set of all guilds supported by the site. Can be optionally filtered to a specific server id.

types.name: ProgressRaceData
types.description: A way to obtain data for the top guilds involved in an ongoing world first or realm first progress race.

fields.name: progressRace
fields.description: Progress race information including best percentages, pull counts and streams for top guilds. This API is only active when there is an ongoing race. The format of this JSON may change without notice and is not considered frozen.

fields.name: detailedComposition
fields.description: Detailed composition data for a given guild and encounter.

types.name: RateLimitData
types.description: A way to obtain your current rate limit usage.

fields.name: limitPerHour
fields.description: The total amount of points this API key can spend per hour.

fields.name: pointsSpentThisHour
fields.description: The total amount of points spent during this hour.

fields.name: pointsResetIn
fields.description: The number of seconds remaining until the points reset.

types.name: ReportData
types.description: The ReportData object enables the retrieval of single reports or filtered collections of reports.

fields.name: report
fields.description: Obtain a specific report by its code.

fields.name: reports
fields.description: A set of reports for a specific guild, guild tag, or user.

types.name: UserData
types.description: The user data object contains basic information about users and lets you retrieve specific users (or the current user if using the user endpoint).

fields.name: user
fields.description: Obtain a specific user by id.

fields.name: currentUser
fields.description: Obtain the current user (only works with user endpoint).

types.name: WorldData
types.description: The world data object contains collections of data such as expansions, zones, encounters, regions, subregions, etc.

fields.name: encounter
fields.description: Obtain a specific encounter by id.

fields.name: expansion
fields.description: A single expansion obtained by ID.

fields.name: expansions
fields.description: The set of all expansions supported by the site.

fields.name: region
fields.description: Obtain a specific region by its ID.

fields.name: regions
fields.description: The set of all regions supported by the site.

fields.name: server
fields.description: Obtain a specific server either by id or by slug and region.

fields.name: subregion
fields.description: Obtain a specific subregion by its ID.

fields.name: zone
fields.description: Obtain a specific zone by its ID.

fields.name: zones
fields.description: Obtain a set of all zones supported by the site.

types.name: ID
types.description:
The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to
refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON
response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable.
When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"4"`) or integer
(such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name and description, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

types.name: SubscriptionStatus
types.description: The type of Subscription.
